statement: What is $\tfrac{1}{2}$ of $10\%$ of $20$?
What is the value of $\dfrac{4444+5555}{1111+2222}$?
How many of the following are factors of $2025$? 15, 25, 45, 75, 225
Jasmin Paris finished a 100-mile race in 59 hours 58 minutes 21 seconds. The cut-off time was 60 hours. By how many seconds did she beat the cut-off?
The diagram shows the square $PQRS$ and the equilateral triangle $PTS$. What is the size of the angle $RPT$?
Carol and Sandra swim in a 25 m pool. Sandra always swims 4 lengths in the same time Carol swims 3 lengths. One morning Carol swims 36 lengths. How far does Sandra swim in the same time?
What is the difference between the smallest four-digit multiple of 3 and the largest three-digit multiple of 4?
Switzerland average consumption is 8.8 kg chocolate per person per year. How many 100 g bars is that?
All four digits of two two-digit numbers are different. What is the smallest possible sum of the two numbers?
The length of a turtle is 60 cm plus a third of its length. How long is the turtle?
Three consecutive one-digit positive integers are a square, a cube and a prime (not necessarily in that order). What is the product of the three integers?
Two identical squares $PQRS$ and $TUVW$ overlap to form the $21\text{ cm}\times12\text{ cm}$ rectangle $PQVW$. What is the area (cm$^2$) of the shaded rectangle $TURS$?

In a sequence of rectangles the first has height 10 cm and width 13 cm. Each subsequent rectangle is 2 cm higher and 1 cm wider than the previous one. How many rectangles in this sequence are squares?
Which of these is equal to $3^3+4^3+5^3$?
A baby weighed 8 pounds 13 ounces. (16 ounces = 1 pound; 1 ounce â‰ˆ 28.35 g.) What was the approximate weight in kilograms?
What is the sum of $20\%$ of $40\%$ of $60$ and $40\%$ of $60\%$ of $80$?
The diagram shows three pairs of parallel line segments. Altogether, how many triangles are there in the diagram?
A number has exactly nine factors (including 1 and itself). The number has 9 and 12 as factors. What is the number?

Ibraheem has 10 cards (four P, three Q, two R, one S) and 10 counters (one 3, two 1, three 4, four 2). He places one counter on each card so every pairing is different. Which pairing does he NOT make?
Points $P,Q,R,S$ lie in that order on a line. $PR=6$ cm, $QS=4$ cm and $R$ is 1 cm nearer to $S$ than to $Q$. What is $PS$?
In the diagram, $PQRS$ and $JKLM$ are squares. Each corner of $JKLM$ is one third of the way along an edge of $PQRS$. What is the ratio of area$(JKLM)$ to area$(PQRS)$?

Idil has 12 bags of sweets. Some bags contain (3 mints, 4 toffees, 1 fudge), some contain (4 mints, 5 toffees, 2 fudges), and the remaining bags contain (6 mints, 0 toffees, 3 fudges). The bags contain 31 toffees in total. In total, how many fudges do the bags contain?

The map shows three towns $P,Q,R$ and the road lengths between them are whole kilometres. The route $P\to Q\to R$ is twice as long as direct $P\to R$. The route $P\to R\to Q$ is three times as long as direct $P\to Q$. Which of the following could be the length of the route from $P$ back to $P$ via $Q$ and $R$?
When 180 is divided by a positive integer $N$, the remainder is 5. For how many values of $N$ is this true?
Given a cube, how many equilateral triangles are there whose vertices are three vertices of the cube?
